intro: Stillingia asperococca, commonly known as the rough-seeded stillingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and related genera. The plant is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves and showy, orange-red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, black seeds. Stillingia asperococca is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
